readme:
# Quantum Entanglement

Connects multiple atom editors over phoenix channels for real time pair programming.

Currently supported:
  * Line number marker of other users (so you don't work on the same line)
  * File sync on save
  * Join/Leave rooms based on name you provide
  * Workspace directories

## Requirements
A quantum entanglement server must be provided in the config. You can host your own with this: https://github.com/nathanjohnson320/quantum-entanglement-server

## Workspace directories
Since projects are commonly located on the same path there is a configuration setting
called `projectPath` which allows you to specify a path where everyone connected will be working.

For example, on my mac I work in directory /Users/nathanjohnson320/workspace/elixir/quantum-server but on my linux desktop I'm in /home/nathan/workspace/elixir/quantum-server. If I want to entangle an atom editor so that both machines can work on the same files I would specify the projectPath as workspace/elixir/quantum-server. Then all files inside quantum-server will be matched properly and ignore any prefix before that.

NOTE: If projectPath is left out it will assume that the paths match exactly.
